intro: Artanthe linguifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf artanthe, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Artanthe linguifolia is typically found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in dry and sunny conditions.
